data.text:
Claude Cat is a WB Studio character from the Looney Tunes/Merrie Melodies series. Claude Cat made a total of 14 appearances during the golden age of animation.

Overview[]

Claude Cat was voiced by Mel Blanc and his first appearance was in the cartoon The Aristo-Cat in 1943. Claude Cat would appear in a total of 14 cartoons during the golden age of animation with the final appearance in the cartoon Cat Feud in 1958.

Appearance/Personality[]

Claude Cat is a pussycat with yellow fur and a white belly with orange hair. Claude was usually on the loosing side of situations. Claude was paired with Hubie & Bertie and did try to catch them but was never able to and would get tricked by the mice. He was also paired with Marc Anthony & Pussyfoot where he could get the best of Marc Anthony but Marc Anthony would beat him throughout the cartoon. Claude is also usually seen to be lazy and very frighted cat. Claude would also be a very nervous cat in particular with his appearances with Hubie & Bertie. It was rumored that Conrad The Cat was a proto-type for Claude but this was denied by WB Studios.

Filmography[]

1943/1958[]

Claude Cat appeared in 7 Looney Tune cartoons and 7 Merrie Melodie cartoons for a total of 14 cartoons.
